meanings.definition: Outmanipulate (verb): to outsmart or outwit through cunning or deceitful tactics.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outmanipulate her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outmanipulate the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was able to outmanipulate the hunter and escape into the woods.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a puzzle, trying to outmanipulate the truth.
meanings.sent5: He used his charm to outmanipulate the situation and come out on top.

meanings.definition: Outmanipulate (adjective): having the ability to outsmart or outwit others through cunning tactics.
meanings.sent1: The outmanipulate spy always had a plan up his sleeve.
meanings.sent2: She had an outmanipulate mind that could solve any problem.
meanings.sent3: The outmanipulate magician amazed the audience with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: His outmanipulate skills in negotiation always led to successful deals.
meanings.sent5: The outmanipulate leader knew how to navigate tricky situations with ease.
